fields.infoText: Before you complete this form, please make sure you read the Alternative Dispute Resolution (ADR) guidance.
This will help you to decide if ADR is the right process to meet your needs.
If you are an authorised agent, please complete the following pages with your client's information and enter your own details in the 'Agent's details' section.

### Please note: 
You are an authorised agent if your client has completed paper forms 64-8 or FBI 2 or you have used HMRC Online Services to set up client authorisations.

fields.label: Are you an authorised agent?
fields.errorMessage: Select if you are an authorised agent.

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: Enter your email address.: HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC) will use this to contact you about this form

sections.title: Enter the details of the person filling in this form
sections.description: HMRC will use these details if we need to discuss this form.

fields.label: Telephone number
fields.helpText: For international numbers include the country code.

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: We will also use this to send you a confirmation email.

fields.label: Are you completing this form on behalf of a client?

sections.title: Which unit in HMRC do you deal with?

fields.errorMessage: Select the HMRC unit you deal with

fields.label: Help with choice meanings
fields.infoText: This form should only be used for substantive tax disputes. For further help on what constitutes a substantive tax dispute please see the ADR guidance. Your latest piece of post from HM Revenue and Customs should indicate whether your tax affairs are dealt with by Small and Medium Enterprise (SME), Individuals & Public Bodies (I&PB), Mid Size Business (MSB), Customs, International Trade and Excise (CITEX), Central Compliance Operations (CCO) or another customer grouping. However, if you are not sure, please select Other.

sections.title: What type of tax is in dispute?

fields.errorMessage: Select the type of tax in dispute

fields.label: Help with HMRC Reference Number
fields.infoText: Enter the HMRC reference number. For example, if the dispute is about Income Tax, enter the Unique Taxpayers Reference. For Corporation Tax, use the Corporation Tax Reference, or for VAT, please enter the VAT Registration Number.
To help HMRC deal with your ADR request, please enter details of your dispute in the fields below.

fields.label: To help HMRC process your application for ADR, outline the issues (in the box below) that are in dispute and any details that you feel are relevant.
Give your reasons (in the box below) for applying for ADR to help settle the dispute.
fields.errorMessage: Give your reasons for applying for ADR

fields.label: How did you hear about ADR?
fields.errorMessage: Give details of how you heard of ADR

fields.label: Agent's Business Name
fields.helpText: Enter your business name (if any) or the name of the organisation that you work for.

fields.label: Agent's address
fields.helpText: Enter the full working address and postcode of your office or main place of work

fields.label: Client Reference Number
fields.helpText: Enter your own or your firm's reference for this client. The reference should be client specific and not include the clients name or other personal information.

fields.infoText: HMRC will include your client's reference in the response to you, but for data security reasons this will not include the client's name or any other personal information.

fields.label: Provide details below of who is signing the declaration
First name
fields.errorMessage: First name can only include letters a to z, numbers, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes

fields.label: Last name
fields.errorMessage: Last name can only include letters a to z, numbers, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes

fields.label: Status
fields.helpText: For example, director, financial controller or secretary
fields.errorMessage: Position in the company can only include letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens and apostrophes

fields.label: To receive confirmation that your return has been submitted, enter an email address below
Email address
fields.errorMessage: Enter a valid email address with no spaces, like name@example.com
